intro: Brachyscome foliosa, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads, typical of the genus Brachyscome. Brachyscome foliosa is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
